name: Glacier Bay Country Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Glacier Bay Country Inn for 4 nights in June, 2008, and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. Most outstanding were the warm, accommodating staff, whose motto is, "We will do whatever it takes to make your time with us wonderful." They arranged our boat cruise on the bay, sea kayaking trip, and whale watch, plus provided transportation to our departure points when needed. They fed us magnificently, including box lunches for our daytime adventures, and were always ready to fill special requests. One of our tablemates at dinner asked for an encore appearance of the mint chocolate chip cheescake he'd enjoyed his first night and, lo and behold, there it was on the menu his last night! We're not usually big on eating with people we don't know, but we were far from minding here because the couple we shared our table with all four nights were absolutely delightful. In fact, all of the guests we met were congenial--the place seems to attract that kind of clientele. One thing to be aware of: the inn changed ownership this spring and the new owners did't have a liquor permit yet, so you may need to buy your own beverage in town if you want something alcoholic. We were able to hitch a ride to the mercantile in the inn van.
reviews.title: A Wonderful Place with Great Food!

reviews.text: We stayed in one of the cabins, which was modern, spotless, tastefully furnished, and equipped with a queen bed, a set of bunks (which we didn't use), and a small but perfectly adequate bath. We would have preferred a seating area instead of the bunks, and the water pressure in the shower was subpar, but these are quibbles in what were excellent accommodations overall. We especially appreciated the supply of bottled water provided, as the well water from the tap had a distinct odor of sulphur.
reviews.title: Great Fishing

reviews.text: The main building, which houses the dining room, common rooms, and some guest rooms, is attractive and equipped with a computer for guest use, comfortable seating, a TV with a DVD player, a small library, puzzles, and even a telescope high in a room at the top. We really didn't take advantage of these amenities because we were so busy out and about, but it was nice to know they were there in case we were at loose ends.
reviews.title: The Alaskan Experience

likes.liked: — Clean and comfortable, private and cozy
likes.disliked: — Entrance door to the main Lodge is awkwardly located

description: Glacier Bay Country Inn is a gateway to Glacier Bay National Park. Their world class service, location, and amazing cuisine from a professional staff will provide you with what guests have called "the best Alaskan Trip ever!!"€� It is why most of their guests return year after year. They offer some of Alaska's best fishing and outdoor adventures: Salt Water Fishing, Fly-Fishing, Kayaking, Whale Watching, Sight-seeing, Hiking, Photography, and Glacier Tours.
